reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf the idea of a 2D sidescroller arena shooter sounds good to you, get this. It works great and has all the potential in the world to be a fun experience. The physics already do their job (and quite well at that, the game always gives you the feeling that you'll be able to do some pretty awesome stuff by mastering movement), it already has a large assortment of weapons, it's just missing those final touches.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a very fun Worms like game.  The game play is simple enough with the goal being to get the most kills before the time limit or to reach the score limit in a free for all deathmatch.  There are many weapons to use ranging from warhammers to bazookas.  All in all a very fun game even in its current Aplha state.
Here is a gameplay review.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was supplied with this key by the developer, this however did not affect the review. All my developer sponsored reviews are positive because I review games that I like!

Carroting Brain
Carroting Brain is a cartoon rabbit shooter. The goal of this game is to kill as many other rabbits as you can with the weapons you find. Have up to 6 A.I rabbits to fight against in a total FFA. Choose from all types of weapons such as sniper rifles, assault rifles, various shotguns, various pistols and melee weapons and MORE. Go to various planets in the deep outer space, visit the moon and other made up planets to fight and destroy.

What to do in the gameTheres not a whole lot to do in this game, its a 2d platform arena with rabits with guns. This game is early access and there will be more content coming soon. They will be adding more guns, more maps and more content. This game shows a lot of potential and can become something great. This game has some amazing and intresting physics that are fun to mess around with.

Pros  Bunnies.
Bunnies with guns.
Fun physics.
Destructible maps.
Bunnies... again

Cons Not very many levels.
No bunny customization.

Final VerdictOverall I rate this game a 7/10 it is still in early access and has some great content. It is still a fun 2d platform game with bunnies. Run, hop and gun your way to victory against the evil bunnies. I recommend this game to anyone who likes platform shooters.

For more recommendations by LL's Game Giveaways and Reviews on quality indie games or ones with high potential follow our group curations Steam Group  LL's Game Giveaways and Reviews

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Thank you Raving Bots
Before I write anything about this game I would like to thank Raving Bots for giving me a code to try the game and a code to giveaway a copy of the game too,  this doesn't affect my review in any way, shape or form.

A little description of the game
Carrotting Brain is a similar game to Worms where you grab weapons from crates and use them to annihilate your enemies, the only difference being you're a Rabbit instead of a Worm.

Pros & Cons
Pros:
Full controller support
Good graphics
Fun to play
Funny sound effects when collecting crates and things (The Rabbits in this game kind of laugh)
The maps are very creative
Cons:
A bit over priced for what's available at the current stage of development (There's only training against AI and split screen but multiplayer and a campaign is coming soon)
The AI are ridiculous to kill and Fatty sponges everything
If you fall off the side of the map you're screwed (Ending up in the water completely froze my game and there's no way to respawn from what I could find)
Extras and gameplay
Overall this game is very fun to play,   I recommend it if blowing up your enemies and jumping around on the moon is your thing and it will be even better when there's more to do and bug fixes.

If my review made no sense to you or you're still unsure about the game, check out my gameplay video here:

https://youtu.be/zJX5Auu0wJ0

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Comical Bunny Murder Arenahttps://youtu.be/T7ZjoALSDwE
+ Quite a wide selection of weapons
+ The low-gravity and certain stages adds a lot of fun especially when you jump between planets and get a kill midflight
+ Gore / Violence is pretty hilarious with cute bunnies
+ Destructable Environment
+ Multiplayer

- Not a whole lot of content or things to do at the moment.
- I feel like the movement could be greatly improved (i'd suggest upping the movement speed, jump height, and perhaps a way to crouch)
- I feel like this game needs a full campaign with a funny story and missions to complete. At the moment it's just an amusing little battle arena that will last a good 10-20minutes or so.

Here's my review (16-Nov-2015):

Somehow there's no way to play this game on keyboard because the default kb+m layout is messed up. So I hooked up my X360 controller and fumbled around in training mode for a while. Even in training mode
hoursPlayed: the controls feel awkward. Fast aiming is a key component in the game with all the bunny hopping going on
voteText: pro stick aiming is a requirement for this game. Only for melee weapon can you just go button mashing and hope your enemies don't come into the fight with anything non-melee or stronger-melee.\n\nIn short
helpfulPercent: this game really needs a lot of work and is therefor an Early Access Game. At the moment
votesHelpful: I strongly recommend against splashing down EUR 11.99 which is probably USD 11.99 on this title."
